required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High Risk Screen of Childhood Late-onset Pompe Disease in Pediatric Outpatient Clinics

brief_summary.textblock: Establish of high-risk screening criteria to earlier identify possible childhood LOPD for early treatment and better prognosis. Therefore, validation of the high-risk screening criteria for childhood LOPD will be critical for identifying children of LOPD in Taiwan.

primary_outcome.measure: clinical signs/symptoms surveyed - Weakness in neck (No.1)
primary_outcome.description: Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: clinical signs/symptoms surveyed - Symptoms and signs of muscle weakness (No.2)
primary_outcome.description: Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria. Symptoms and signs of muscle weakness including Frequent fall, difficulty to climb stairs, poor performance in physical education classes, gait abnormalities or facial weakness.

primary_outcome.measure: clinical signs/symptoms surveyed - Unable to speak clearly / keep slobbering (No.3)
primary_outcome.description: Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria.

Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria.

Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria.

Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. primary_outcome.measure: clinical signs/symptoms surveyed - Urinary / Fecal incontinence (No.9)
primary_outcome.description: Children from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH will be surveyed whether they have clinical signs/symptoms. Any patients who fulfill symptom No. 1 or 3 associated to the difficulty of flexing the neck from supine position or accumulated 3 findings from pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation will be referred to pediatric neurology for double confirmation that patients meet the criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: dry blood sample (DBS) - GAA activity analysis
primary_outcome.description: Then we will use dry blood sample (DBS) or whole blood sample for screening the possibility of Pompe disease.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who are >1 year and < 18 year of age will be enrolled from outpatient clinics of pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who are >1 year and < 18 year of age from pediatric neurology, pediatric orthopedics and pediatric rehabilitation in NTUH
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who have been diagnosed as specific neuromuscular disorders.
